item.title: Robin Hood Hashing
item.description:
I found an interesting story about Robin Hood when I first learned about Robin Hood Hash(and there is another RobinHood that provides financial services, which I don’t believe is a coincidence). Robin Hood was a bandit, but he was a good guy who robbed the rich in order to give to the poor. And that implies the basic idea behind Robin Hood Hash.

Basically, hash table has two different ways to store the key-value pairs. The one is separate chaining and the other is open addressing. Robin Hood Hashing is a variation of open addressing in hash tables. It aims to minimize the variance in probe sequence lengths by ensuring that elements with longer probe sequences “steal” slots from elements with shorter probe sequences. This approach helps balance the load and reduces clustering, improving overall performance.
